intro: Terminalia benguellensis, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its rounded, ball-like clusters of white flowers that appear at the ends of branches, giving it its common name. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Terminalia benguellensis is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
